snippet: Ms. Bing helped to popularize the natural childbirth movement, reducing the need for anesthesia and giving mothers more control over the process of childbirth.
abstract: Elisabeth Bing, leader of movement that revolutionized how mothers give birth in United States, dies at age 100; worked tirelessly for more than 50 years to promote natural childbirth methods of Dr Fernand Lamaze, favoring relaxation techniques over anesthesia and enabling women to be conscious as their children came into world; methods are now commonplace in delivery rooms, and one in four mothers-to-be continue to attend Lamaze classes.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Bing helped to popularize the natural childbirth movement, reducing the need for anesthesia and giving mothers more control over the process of childbirth.

headline.main: Elisabeth Bing Dies at 100; ‘Mother of Lamaze’ Helped Change Childbirth
headline.print_headline: Elisabeth Bing, 100, Who Changed How U.S. Babies Enter World, Dies
